Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe; cream slip; interior reserved; exterior: painted decoration consisting of muzzled horse (dilute brown muzzle and part of dark painted bridle remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Animals such as muzzled horses do not appear in the Chian repertoire until the Grand Style, circa 580 BC.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 34, no. 47, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 284, no. 807, pl. 112)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. X, middle of page)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0056) (phase 2)
